Generate a line list from a branching process model parameterised by reproduction number

Source: R/standalone-test-utils.R
dot-test_branching_process.Rd

Generate a line list from a branching process model parameterised by reproduction number

Usage

sim_branching_process(
  changes = tibble::tibble(t = c(0, 40), R_t = c(2.5, 0.8)),
  kappa = 1,
  ip = ggoutbreak::covid_ip,
  max_time = 80,
  initial = 30,
  seed = Sys.time(),
  summarise = TRUE,
  ...
)

Arguments

changes

a dataframe containing a t time column and R_t reproduction number parameter.

kappa

a dispersion parameter controlling the likelihood of individual super-spreading. This must be between 1 and Inf with 1 being standard poisson dispersion and large values representing over dispersion.

ip

a data frame with time, and probability columns

max_time

maximum duration of simulation

initial

initial outbreak size

seed

random seen

summarise

if FALSE return the line list of one entry per person

...

Arguments passed on to .summarise_with_ascertainment

p.asc

the background probability of a case being detected

kappa.asc

a dispersion parameter controlling the day to day variability of ascertainment between 0 (no dispersion) and Inf (maximum)

Value

either a line list of cases, with individual ids, infection times, and infector ids or a summary case count time series,

Examples

if (interactive()) {

tmp = sim_branching_process(
  changes = tibble::tibble(t = c(0,20,40,60,80,110), R_t = c(1.8,1.5,0.9,1.5,0.8,1.2)),
  kappa = 2,
  max_time = 120,
  p.asc= 0.8,
  kappa.asc = 1.01,
  seed = 100
)

mean(tmp$dispersion)
ggplot2::ggplot(tmp, ggplot2::aes(x=time,y=count))+ggplot2::geom_point()

}
